Gradient colour scales for bottom-right triangle in geom_asymmat

Source: R/scale_gradient.R
scale_fill_br_gradient.Rd

This dictates a gradient color scheme for the bottom-right (br) of a geom_asymmat ggplot geom. scale_*_br_gradient creates a two colour gradient (low-high), scale_*_br_gradient2 creates a diverging colour gradient (low-mid-high), scale_*_br_gradientn creates a n-colour gradient.

scale_fill_br_gradient(..., low = "#132B43", high = "#56B1F7",
  space = "Lab", na.value = "grey50", guide = "colourbar",
  aesthetics = "fill_br")

Arguments

...

arguments passed on to continuous_scale_asym
low

the colors to represent low and high values
high

the colors to represent low and high values
space

colour space in which to calculate gradient. Must be "Lab" - other values are deprecated.
na.value

color of missing (NA) values
guide

Type of legend. Use "colourbar" for continuous colour bar, or "legend" for discrete colour legend.
aesthetics

Character string or vector of character strings listing the name(s) of the aesthetic(s) that this scale works with. For now, leave the default alone, though I plan to reinstate the standard ggplot system here, eventually.

Examples

# vignette(ggasym)
